intro: Opisthopappus taihangensis, commonly known as the Taihang mountain aster, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, and it produces small, bristly seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Opisthopappus taihangensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
